In October 2014, the World Health Organization (WHO) launched an initiative to stimulate diagnostic innovations to bring novel accurate tests to the point-of-care level. Decreasing the turnaround time for diagnosis through such assays would allow triaging and treating appropriate patients as swiftly as possible. The 2 key initiatives aim to rapidly solicit products that meet a prespecified “ideal profile” of the next generation of diagnostic tests and to provide a rapid review process for assessing a diagnostic test's quality, safety, and performance.
